page.title: 19FARMING(CONEY HALL)
page.content: AT WICKHAM COURT THE LAND IS OWNED BY MR DILLAN THE FARMER.THERE ARE 479 ACRES ALTOGETHER 65 ACRES OF IT IS WHEAT 13 ACRES OF IT IS PEAS AND 15 ACRES IS POTATOES 15 ACRES OF BARLEY AND THE REST OIL SEED RAPE.HIS HOUSE WAS BUILT AROUND 1850.THE BARLEY IS GROWN WITH THE WHEAT BECAUSE THE BIRDS LIKE WHEAT BUT PREFER THE BARLEY SO BY THE TIME THE WHEAT IS READY FOR HARVESTING THE BARLEY HAS ALL BEEN EATEN BY THE BIRDS BUT HARDLY ANY OF THE WHEAT HAS BEEN TOUCHED.OIL SEED RAPE FROM A DISTANCE LOOKS VERY MUCH LIKE MUSTARD BUT THERE IS QUITE A LOT OF DIFFERENCE.THE PLANT COMES FROM THE CABBAGE FAMILY IT HAS LITTLE PODS ON IT WHICH GROW TO ABOUT 4 CMS THEN WHEN THEY ARE RIPE IN THE PODS ARE VERY LITTLE BLACK BALL BEARING LIKE SEEDS.THE PLANT CONTAINS 40% OIL AND IT GOES TO MAKE THINGS LIKE MARGARINE,
